snippet: Two months after her design for a 2020 Olympic stadium in Tokyo was scrapped because of spiraling costs, the Iraqi-British architect Zaha Hadid has taken herself out of the running for the project’s next round of competition.
abstract: Pritzker Architecture Prize winner Zaha Hadid removes herself from Tokyo’s 2020 Olympic stadium design competition after government scraps her $2.5 billion design, saying it is too costly; Hadid says she could not find a contractor to partner with her in creating a second design, which is required under competition rules.
lead_paragraph: Two months after her design for a 2020 Olympic stadium in Tokyo was scrapped because of spiraling costs, the Iraqi-British architect Zaha Hadid has taken herself out of the running for the project’s next round of competition.

headline.main: Zaha Hadid Withdraws From Competition to Design Tokyo Olympic Stadium
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; Japan: Architect Leaves Contest for Olympic Stadium
